intro: Erythrococca natalensis, commonly known as Natal red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some regions.
